ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned how to think about social issues through the lens of close-looking at art.
Thought about art, thought about how to look at art, thought about social movements

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This course was great! I really appreciate the range of social issues and artists that we covered.

Strengths - basically everything.  Minimal reading meant that I went into class fresh and excited.  The artwork was great.  The professor did a great job facilitating discussion and talking about difficult topics.  The final paper was manageable

No weaknesses

The biggest strength of this course is the opportunity to dive deeply into amazing artwork in a close-knit classroom environment--it's truly unlike any other Yale course that I've taken. I thought that the themes were well-chosen and spaced well sequentially, and we had some great guest speakers. The only thing is that more feedback along the way on response papers and on our final project would've been helpful, but overall I loved the class.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: For not being able to go to the gallery in person, I appreciate how this course was still engaging and interesting in a virtual format.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, this course is a great way to learn how to close-look at art and think about it in the broader context of social issues.
Definitely.  Very chill, safe space, relaxing.  Almost therapeutic class.  If you are interested in contemporary art and have an open mind, this is a great class!!

Yes, I would definitely recommend this course to another student who enjoys interdisciplinary methods of approaching problems. I loved thinking through the artwork, and we definitely developed class camaraderie that I believe would've been even greater in person.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
